N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 503.3 - Applicability

State Regulations
(a) This Part shall
apply to the following adjudicatory proceedings brought by or before the Office
of Mental Health pursuant to the Mental Hygiene Law and/or regulations issued
pursuant thereto: (1)
hearings, afforded an
applicant, on the disapproval of an application for construction of a facility
pursuant to Mental Hygiene Law, section 31.23 and Parts 53 and 551 of this

Title; (2)
hearings on the denial
of application for or limitation of initial operating certificate pursuant to

Mental Hygiene Law, section 31.05; (3)
hearings on the suspension, revocation or
limitation of an operating certificate, or the imposition of fines pursuant to

Mental Hygiene Law, section 31.16; (4)
hearings on the emergency suspension or
limitation of an operating certificate pursuant to Mental Hygiene Law, section
31.16; (5)
hearings on the issuance
of a cease and desist order pursuant to Mental Hygiene Law, section
31.19; (6)
hearings, afforded an
applicant, on the disapproval of an application for certificate of
incorporation pursuant to Mental Hygiene Law, section 31.22 and Part 551 of
this Title; (7)
hearings held
pursuant to any law or regulation giving a facility licensed by the Office of

Mental Health the right to request a hearing to appeal a determination by the
commissioner regarding the facility's request for revision of a certified rate
of payment; and
(8)
hearings held
pursuant to any law or regulation giving a facility licensed by the Office of

Mental Health the right to request a hearing to appeal an agency audit finding
which results in a proposed revision of a certified rate of payment. (b) This Part supersedes Part 73
as it relates to services for the mentally ill. Notes
